data.text:
Husband and I currently live overseas and travel in Europe frequently. We decided to visit Ephesus and head out from Izmir using Viator (owned by Trip Advisor) or Get your Guide v. renting a car. Wise choice as parking in Izmir would be a nightmare, and the underground garage at this hotel also looked like a stressful situation. We originally booked at Swiss, but then decided to save some money. We looked at this 13/154 rating in Trip Advisor (not sure how they came up w/that good nos), and based on ranking and reviews, we decided to stay here.
The good - rooms are very clean and housekeeping came each day. Mini-fridge in room, which was nice. TV has 2-3 English-speaking news channels which we found. Management must have recently put in fake vinyl flooring v. carpet, which was a plus. Bed mattress firm and slept fine (except for bottom sheet quality, which I will get to soon). Breakfast is good and has a variety of a Turkish items - if you like olives and cheese, there are many to choose from. There were boiled and omelette-type eggs.  Honeycomb and fresh bread, store-bought cake or cookies (one of each on a plate). Same bfast each of 5 days we stayed.  Unfortunately, no yogurt..turns out Turks eat yogurt from noon onwards, not bfast. Staff were pleasant enough - shout out to Katar and Elgin. LOCATION OF THIS HOTEL is best thing - much better located to bazaar, clock tower, Agora and main sights of Izmir that Movenpic, Swissotel, or Park by Radison.  They are several blocks north.
The BAD - DARK rooms. When I say dark - the pictures shown, if not enhanced, must be taken on a summer day at noon. No overhead lighting, and the 2 sconces on either side of bed just didn't cut it.  The bed we got (And what i saw when i peeked in some rooms getting cleaned) was a  double - NOT a queen. The headboard was clearly for a queen or king, but we weren't keen on the double, but had no choice. There are only 2 outlets (mentioned in a review) which didn't bother us, but be aware. The 24/7 coffee/cappuccino machine was odd. no milk was coming out and final result definitely not a cappuccino. in fact, they must know it is older machine, bc they always had a pot of coffee and another large carafe of coffee near machine at bfast. We had a city/street view - not bad, and double-paned windows kept out most of the noise, but we were on top (5th) floor, so can't speak for rooms below.
The UGLY - the linens. First, the sheets - the bottom sheet was so pilled, i asked for it to be changed next day. The next one not much better. The duvet was a single, yet on a double bed. We didn't ask for another, but it was a tug and pull with my husband, sometimes at night as it barely covered the double (not queen) bed. Second, THE TOWELS - isn't Turkey known for its' Turkish Towels and textiles? These towels, although sized-well need to be replaced. They were old, needed bleach and were so overwashed and thin, we actually asked for replacements each day. If management would invest in some good, thicker towels and tell guests they won't be replaced even that would work.
Finally, as one mentioned earlier - do NOT try to save money with lowest room bc your window will be actually looking into the hotel and very small room. Good location, good for 1-2 night stay; and, just lower your expectations on rest.
data.title: Good Location and Clean hotel for short stay in Izmir

data.text: Had a great stay room was very comfortable with everything you need at hand. Bed was comfy and room cleaned every day with fresh towels. All staff I met were very friendly and helpful. It's a quirky hotel every time I went through reception something new caught my eye  hope to return again in the future. Xx
data.title: A great week in a charming hotel

data.text:
Tiny double room. It should be single. 
Only two sockets for two people. I had to choose what to recharge: mobile phone or camera?
Almost clean toilet.
Nice breakfast.
We had paid dinner included. There was no buffet. It was just a main dish. We didn't know when booked, that we had to pay extra for salad or refreshment......
data.title: Could be much better

data.text:
From 02.09 to 07.09. 2023 we had the pleasure of being guests of this hotel. The hotel is located near historical sites, as well as metro and tram stops. The hotel is in a very quiet place. This is very important for tourists like us. The hotel accommodation was perfect as was our stay thanks to the exceptional hotel staff. These are kind and polite people who always helped us. The rooms are comfortable and equipped with everything a person needs. The hotel's restaurant is at a high level, as well as the food offered there. We were especially impressed by the aquariums for fish, the aviary for parrots, as well as the small garden of the hotel, where you can drink tea or coffee.
I highly recommend the hotel to everyone who will visit Izmir.
I thank the entire team of the hotel for the created holiday conditions and kind attitude.
data.title: excellent hotel

data.text: Well managed boutique hotel with good facilities and large breakfast. Close enough to Basame train/metro and about 500m from the bazaar. Surrounding side streets have shade and food options. We felt safe and comfortable here. Recommended.
data.title: A pleasant stay
